channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Significant food waste in street, will attract rats, 16th October
item.description:
Food packaging waste in street is an ongoing issue caused by overflowing bins and lack of street cleaners

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Gunton Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lack of road and pavement cleaning on our section of the street near Line Tree House., 16th October
item.description:
• Please give brief details of your complaint or compliment below: Dear Bromley Council, I am writing to raise a concern regarding the lack of road and pavement cleaning on our section of the street near Line Tree House. Over the past year, I have noticed that our part of the road has never been cleaned by the council’s maintenance team. Despite seeing the cleaning team attend to the opposite side of the road several times, they consistently skip our side. I have even spoken with the team directly, and they advised me to file a formal complaint as a different team is supposedly responsible for our section. In the meantime, I have had to clean the area myself, but I am becoming increasingly tired of doing so. The pavement is constantly covered in leaves and debris, which frequently blow into my home when I open the door. When it rains, the situation worsens, leaving the area slippery and unpleasant. This ongoing neglect is unacceptable, and I am requesting that Bromley Council arrange for our section of the street to be properly cleaned as part of the regular maintenance schedule. I would appreciate it if someone could look into this matter urgently and confirm when cleaning will resume. • What action (if any) would you like us to take? Clean the side of my road • Have you already spoken to somebody in the Council about this matter? yes • If yes, and you know who you spoke to please provide details and dates: Spoke to the Bromley maintenance team which we’re cleaning the other section of the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Main Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Fly-tip Large - More than a van load

item.title: Irregular tip site, 16th October
item.description:
There's 50t or more of mixed waste there, highly irregular. I'll bet it's making lots of money for various parties but it poses a health risk and a SERIOUS fire risk. I work next to a registered waste transfer site, so I know these things have to be properly regulated and licensed. I see this has been reported, but it's been growing for ages, a year or more. Padlock the yard there and put a stop to it, for G's sake!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ilderton Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tenants of 50 Green Lanes Housing Association flats dropping rubbish in bins belonging to Bridge Gardens, 16th October
item.description:
The tenants in the housing association flats have been using the bins outside our gates (and on our private land) which belong to us (the freeholders and owners of Bridge Gardens). Please inform them that they may not use these bins. Thanks
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bridge Gardens, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
